bibl.title: Moy Wah v. J. C. Drake. Marshal's Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.p: Printed and Sold by the Puget Sound Printing Co., Tacoma, Wash.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, Ninth Judicial Circuit~~~District of Washington.
IN THE MATTER OF Moy Wah ON HABEAS CORPUS.
The President of the United States of America, To The United States Marshal for the District of Washington.

You are Hereby Commanded, That you have the body of Moy Wah. by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name he shall be called or charged, before the Honorable the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Ninth judicial Circuit, District of Washington, at the Court-room of said Court, in the City of Seattle on the 12th day of June 1893 at ten o'clock a.m., to do and receive what shall then be considered in the premises. And have you then and there this Writ.

Witness, the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, and the seal of said Circuit Court, this 8th day of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety three, and of our Independence the 117th

In obedience to the within Writ, I hereby produce the body of Moy Wah as within directed and return that I hold Moy Wah in my custody, by virtue of an order of U S District Court- Western Division dated June 5th 1893 remanding said Moy Wah unto the Custody of the United States Marshal to be placed on board the steamship from which he was taken
Circuit Court of the United States, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, Northern Division
IN THE MATTER OF Moy Wah ON HABEAS CORPUS
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RETURN THERETO.
Filed on return, this 12 day of June 1893
